abstract: Most important, if your campaigns aren’t going into the black after a lot of effort to make them work, don’t keep spending money.
snippet: Most important, if your campaigns aren’t going into the black after a lot of effort to make them work, don’t keep spending money.
lead_paragraph: A few days ago, I described how a stay-at-home mom named Amy Gottesman built a six-figure party-entertainment business largely via the effective use of Google AdWords and other pay-per-click advertising services. These services allow a company to bid on certain keywords and phrases, and if the bid is high enough a short ad from the company will appear alongside the search results of anyone typing those words into a search engine and on some other Web sites. The business then pays the bid price — it can be anywhere from pennies to more than a thousand dollars depending on the competition for those words — every time someone clicks on the ad.
